definition: office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.english: In my early encounters with Philip, food featured.
sentences.chinese: 在我与菲利普最初的相遇中，饭局起了很重要的作用。

sentences.english: At table we drink baijiu, because this is the culture.
sentences.chinese: 在饭局上，我们喝白酒，这是文化使然。

sentences.english: Many stars will become dinner-party material of people.
sentences.chinese: 很多明星会成为人们饭局的谈资。

sentences.english: Mary's banquet is held at Lijing restaurant at 7 on Saturday evening.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽的饭局在丽晶酒店，时间是周六晚上七点。

sentences.english: It is a strong word to attend every banquet.
sentences.chinese: 参加每一场饭局确实言重了。

sentences.english: When my turn came to organize ameal, I spent about twice as much。
sentences.chinese: 而轮到我组织饭局时，我花了大约两倍的钱。

sentences.english: This is the real reason that people are never bored with it.
sentences.chinese: 这就是许多人对饭局乐此不疲的原因。

sentences.english: Meet with friends, Luankan quackish to attend the dinner to meet the stomach.
sentences.chinese: 朋友相聚，乱侃胡吹，参加饭局，满足肠胃。

definition: communal meal/formal dinner of club or group
Ding Lei (1971-), founder and CEO of NetEase 網易|网易[Wang3 yi4]
to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
to give a dinner party/to entertain guests/to invite to dinner
gambling get-together/game of cards, mahjong etc
